column4: Help please my kernel is messed up!  i just installed the new kernel, and that kernel will not work at all!  I tried reinstalling it, to no avail!.
the 2.6.24-20 ? that has known critical issues on launchpad ..
then why was it released into the repos?!  b/c it will not get past the "starting up" script for me.
actually it is in proposed, so you can expect glitches if you have that enabled :)
for now there's still no fix
i have another question, in software sources i am not able to click important security updates, is there a way i can check it anyhoo?
you can try via synaptic .. settings > repositories > updates
when i try to click on the security ones in the software sources, it doesn't work...
could be they are missing in your /etc/apt/sources.list ..
when i click on it in there, all it does is pretend click, and then no check :|
then how to fix...
check that file with an editor and uncomment the sources entress if they are commented out
what ones EXACTLY am i looking for... i don't see anything commented out that shouldn't be, and  what is this:  http://ppa.launchpad.net/flam3/ubuntu hardy main?
i don't know, no bell sringing with that ppa sorry .. as for the sources issue, could you paste your sources.list somewhere ?
yes.
http://paste.ubuntu.com/30157/
checking, give me a minute
kk
looks okay .. and in software sources, first tab labeled 'Ubuntu Software' you can't activate the 'source code' entree ?
correct, it is set to a negative button
can't explain that, but perhaps try and change that by running it under sudo ..
okay, no problem
so now i can click sources, but still no security.
